template.name: HPE Synergy by HTTP
template.description:
This template is designed to monitor HPE Synergy by HTTP. It works without any external scripts and uses the script item.
Setup: 1. Link template to the host. 2. Configure macros {$HPE.SYNERGY.API.USERNAME} and {$HPE.SYNERGY.API.PASSWORD}.
You can discuss this template or leave feedback on our forum https://www.zabbix.com/forum/zabbix-suggestions-and-feedback/
Template tooling version used: 0.41

item.name: HPE Synergy: Get data
item.description: The JSON with the result from requests to API.

item.name: HPE Synergy: Get errors
item.description: A list of errors from API requests.

trigger.name: HPE Synergy: There are errors in requests to API
trigger.description: Zabbix has received errors from API.

item.name: HPE Synergy: Get ethernet networks data
HPE Synergy: Get FC networks data
HPE Synergy: Get hypervisor managers data
HPE Synergy: Get logical enclosures data
HPE Synergy: Get server hardware data
HPE Synergy: Get storage pools data
HPE Synergy: Get storage systems data
HPE Synergy: Get storage volumes data
HPE Synergy: Get uplink sets data
HPE Synergy: Service ping
item.description: Checks if the service is running and accepting the TCP connections.

discovery_rule.name: Appliance bays discovery
discovery_rule.description: A list of the appliance bays in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Power state
item_prototype.description:
The power state of the appliance bay.
*EFuse* - the power state of the bay - it has been EFused. *Reset* - the power state of the bay - it has been reset. *SoftReset* - the power state of the bay - it has been softly reset. *Unknown* - the power state of the bay is unknown.

item_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Get data
item_prototype.description: Data of the appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}].

item_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Model
item_prototype.description: The model name of the appliance.

item_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Part number
item_prototype.description: The part number of the appliance.

item_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Powered on
item_prototype.description: *Yes*, if the appliance is powered on; *false*, otherwise.

item_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Presence
Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Serial number
item_prototype.description: The serial number of the appliance.

item_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Spare part number
item_prototype.description: The spare part number of the appliance.

item_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Status

trigger_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Has critical status
trigger_prototype.description: The appliance [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}] status is critical. Needs immediate attention.

trigger_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Has warning status
trigger_prototype.description: The appliance [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}] status is warning. Needs attention soon.

trigger_prototype.name: Appliance bay [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Is disabled
trigger_prototype.description: The appliance [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}] is currently not operational

discovery_rule.name: Cross bars discovery
discovery_rule.description: SDX cross fabric module connects to all computing devices installed in the system enclosure and brings in the capability of hard partitioning. Crossbar details are relevant only for enclosures with type "SDX".

trigger_prototype.name: Crossbar [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Is subsumed
trigger_prototype.description: The device slot is configured to be part of another device slot.

item_prototype.name: Crossbar [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Serial number
item_prototype.description: A serial number.

trigger_prototype.name: Crossbar [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Has critical status
trigger_prototype.description: The crossbar [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}] status is critical. Needs immediate attention.

item_prototype.description: The current state of the resource. The valid values include Adding, AddError, Configured, CredentialError, Refreshing, RefreshError, Removing, RemoveError, and Unmanaged.

trigger_prototype.name: Datacenter [{#NAME}]: Has refresh error
trigger_prototype.description: The datacenter [{#NAME}] has a refresh error.

trigger_prototype.name: Datacenter [{#NAME}]: Has remove error
trigger_prototype.description: The datacenter [{#NAME}] has a remove error.

trigger_prototype.description: The datacenter [{#NAME}] status is critical. Needs immediate attention.

trigger_prototype.description: The datacenter [{#NAME}] status is warning. Needs attention soon.

item_prototype.description: The power allocated for the enclosed blade.

discovery_rule.name: Enclosures discovery
discovery_rule.description: A list of enclosures resources.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Appliance bays count
item_prototype.description: The number of the appliance bays in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Get data
item_prototype.description: Data of the enclosure [{#NAME}].

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Device bays count
item_prototype.description: The number of the device bays in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Device bays power
item_prototype.description: The amount of power allocated for the blades in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Power allocated for fans and management devices
item_prototype.description: The amount of the power allocated for the fans and management devices of the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Fan bays count
item_prototype.description: The number of the fan bays in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Firmware baseline
item_prototype.description: The name of the current firmware baseline.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Interconnect bays count
item_prototype.description: The number of the interconnect bays in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Interconnect bays power
item_prototype.description: The amount of power allocated for the interconnects in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Min power supplies
item_prototype.description: The minimum number of the power supplies needed.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Min power supplies for redundant power feed
item_prototype.description: The minimum number of the power supplies needed to fulfill the redundant line feed power mode.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Model
item_prototype.description: The enclosure model name, for example, "BladeSystem c7000 Enclosure G2.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Part number
item_prototype.description: The part number of the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Power capacity
item_prototype.description: The power capacity based on power mode.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Total allocated power
item_prototype.description: The total amount of the power allocated in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Total available power
item_prototype.description: The amount of the unallocated power in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Power supply bays count
item_prototype.description: The number of the power supply bays in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Serial number
item_prototype.description: The serial number of the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: State
Enclosure [{#NAME}]: State reason

trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Is missing
trigger_prototype.description: The enclosure is no longer connected into the frame link topology.

trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Is unowned
trigger_prototype.description: The enclosure reports are not being under the management.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Status
item_prototype.description:
The overall health status of the enclosure. The enclosure status reflects the hardware health of the enclosure, all the bays, and the enclosure components (e.g. the enclosure mid-plane, fans, power supplies, Synergy Frame Link Modules, and Synergy Composers). It explicitly does not include the status of the other HPE OneView resources such as the blades (server hardware), the interconnects, and the drive enclosures.
*Critical* - requires immediate attention. *Disabled* - the resource is currently not operational. *OK* - indicates normal/informational behavior. *Unknown* - the health status is not yet known or cannot be determined. *Warning* - requires attention soon.

trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Has critical status
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the enclosure [{#NAME}] is critical. Needs immediate attention.

trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Has warning status
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the enclosure [{#NAME}] is warning. Needs attention soon.

trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Is disabled
trigger_prototype.description: The enclosure [{#NAME}] is currently not operational.

item_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Type
item_prototype.description: The type of the enclosure, for example, "C7000" or "SY12000" or "SDX".

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.enclosure["{#NAME}",state])=3 and last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.enclosure["{#NAME}",state_reason])>-1
trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Is interrupted
trigger_prototype.description: The previous operation on the enclosure did not complete. The operation should be re-attempted.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.enclosure["{#NAME}",state])=9 and last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.enclosure["{#NAME}",state_reason])>-1
trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Is unsupported
trigger_prototype.description: The enclosure model or version is not currently supported by HPE OneView. It cannot be configured or monitored.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.enclosure["{#NAME}",state])=6 and last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.enclosure["{#NAME}",state_reason])>-1
trigger_prototype.name: Enclosure [{#NAME}]: Remove failed
trigger_prototype.description: The previous operation to remove the enclosure did not succeed. The operation should be re-attempted.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.hypervisor_manager["{#NAME}",state])=3 and length(last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.hypervisor_manager["{#NAME}",state_reason]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: Hypervisor manager [{#NAME}]: Is in error state
trigger_prototype.description: The hypervisor manager [{#NAME}] has an error.

discovery_rule.name: Interconnects discovery
discovery_rule.description: Interconnects are centrally managed by their containing logical interconnect. The interconnect provides a physical view of a detailed downlink and uplink port state and configuration, including the current link state, speed, port role (uplink, downlink, or stacking), current pluggable media, power state, and immediate connected neighbor.

item_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Get data
item_prototype.description: Data of the interconnect [{#NAME}].

item_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Hardware health
item_prototype.description: The health status of the interconnect hardware.

item_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Model
item_prototype.description: The interconnect model.

item_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Part number
item_prototype.description: The part number of the interconnect.

item_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Port count
item_prototype.description: The number of ports on the interconnect.

item_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Serial number
item_prototype.description: The serial number of the interconnect.

item_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Spare part number
item_prototype.description: The spare part number of the interconnect.

item_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: State
item_prototype.description: The current state of the resource.

item_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Status

trigger_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Has critical status
trigger_prototype.description: The interconnect [{#NAME}] status is critical. Needs immediate attention.

trigger_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Has warning status
trigger_prototype.description: The interconnect [{#NAME}] status is warning. Needs attention soon.

trigger_prototype.name: Interconnect [{#NAME}]: Is disabled

discovery_rule.description: A list of the logical enclosures.

item_prototype.name: Logical enclosure [{#NAME}]: Get data
item_prototype.description: Data of the logical enclosure [{#NAME}].

item_prototype.name: Logical enclosure [{#NAME}]: State

trigger_prototype.name: Logical enclosure [{#NAME}]: Delete failed
trigger_prototype.description: Indicator that the deletion of a logical enclosure failed.

trigger_prototype.name: Logical enclosure [{#NAME}]: Is inconsistent
trigger_prototype.description: The configuration of the logical enclosure differs from that of the enclosure group, or the configuration of the hardware resources is inconsistent with the logical enclosure configuration. Perform an Update from group, Reapply configuration, or Update firmware action as an appropriate to bring the configuration back into consistency.

item_prototype.name: Logical enclosure [{#NAME}]: Status

trigger_prototype.name: Logical enclosure [{#NAME}]: Has critical status
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the logical enclosure [{#NAME}] is critical. Needs immediate attention.

trigger_prototype.name: Logical enclosure [{#NAME}]: Has warning status
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the logical enclosure [{#NAME}] is warning. Needs attention soon.

trigger_prototype.name: Logical enclosure [{#NAME}]: Is disabled
trigger_prototype.description: The logical enclosure [{#NAME}] is currently not operational.

discovery_rule.name: nPar discovery
discovery_rule.description: Electrically isolated hardware partition (nPar). Partition details are relevant only for enclosures with type "SDX".

item_prototype.name: Partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}]: Get data
item_prototype.description: Data of the partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}].

item_prototype.name: Partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}]: Devices count
item_prototype.description: The number of blades in the partition.

item_prototype.name: Partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}]: Health
item_prototype.description:
Indicates the health of the partition and the health of its owned resources (blades and IO bays) as reported by the firmware. If a problem is detected with one of the resources, the health of the partition is reported as Degraded. If all the resources in the partition are operating correctly, the health of the partition is reported as OK.
*NparDegrade* - one or more resources in the partition are unhealthy. *NparHealthInvalid* - a partition health is invalid. *NparHealthMax* - a delimiter defined by the firmware. *NparOk* - all the resources in the partition are healthy.

trigger_prototype.name: Partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}]: Health is degraded
trigger_prototype.description: One or more resources in the partition are unhealthy.

trigger_prototype.name: Partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}]: Health is invalid
trigger_prototype.description: The partition health is invalid.

item_prototype.name: Partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}]: Memory
item_prototype.description: The total memory of the partition.

item_prototype.name: Partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}]: Processors Count
item_prototype.description: The number of processors in the partition.

item_prototype.name: Partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}]: Status

trigger_prototype.name: Partition [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#PARTITION_ID}]: Is invalid
trigger_prototype.description: The partition status is invalid.

discovery_rule.name: Power supplies discovery
discovery_rule.description: List of power supply bays in the enclosure.

item_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Get data
item_prototype.description: Data of the power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}].

item_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Model
item_prototype.description: The common descriptive model of the power supply.

item_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Output capacity
item_prototype.description: The output capacity of the power supply.

item_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Part number
item_prototype.description: The part number of the power supply.

item_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Presence
Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Serial number
item_prototype.description: The unique serial number of the power supply.

item_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Spare part number
item_prototype.description: The spare part number to be used when ordering an additional or replacement power supply of this type.

item_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Status

trigger_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Has critical status
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the power supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}] is critical. Needs immediate attention.

trigger_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Has warning status
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the power supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}] is warning. Needs attention soon.

trigger_prototype.name: Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}]: Is disabled
trigger_prototype.description: The status of Power Supply [{#ENCLOSURE_NAME}:{#BAY_NUMBER}] is currently not operational.

discovery_rule.name: Racks discovery
discovery_rule.description: A list of the racks.

item_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: Get data
item_prototype.description: Data of the rack [{#NAME}].

item_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: State
item_prototype.description: The current state of the resource. the valid values include Adding, AddError, Configured, CredentialError, Refreshing, RefreshError, Removing, RemoveError, and Unmanaged.

trigger_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: Add error
trigger_prototype.description: Adding the rack [{#NAME}] failed.

trigger_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: Has credential error
trigger_prototype.description: The rack [{#NAME}] has credential error.

trigger_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: Has refresh error
trigger_prototype.description: The rack [{#NAME}] has refresh error.

trigger_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: Has remove error
trigger_prototype.description: The rack [{#NAME}] has remove error.

item_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: Status

trigger_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: Has critical status
trigger_prototype.description: The rack [{#NAME}] status is critical. Needs immediate attention.

trigger_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: Has warning status
trigger_prototype.description: The rack [{#NAME}] status is warning. Needs attention soon.

trigger_prototype.name: Rack [{#NAME}]: Is disabled
trigger_prototype.description: The rack [{#NAME}] is currently not operational.

discovery_rule.name: Server hardware discovery
discovery_rule.description: The server hardware resource is a representation of a physical server.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Processor cores count
item_prototype.description: The number of cores available per processor.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Processors count
item_prototype.description: The number of processors installed on this server hardware.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Processor speed
item_prototype.description: The speed of the CPUs.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Processor type
item_prototype.description: The type of the CPU installed on this server hardware.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Get data
item_prototype.description: Data of the server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}].

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Maintenance state
item_prototype.description: The maintenance flag of the Server Hardware - disruptive maintenance operations, such as firmware update, can cause many server hardware alerts to be generated in a short period of time. Example: network connectivity is lost or the server reset is detected. When this field is set, predefined alerts for this particular device are suppressed. This field is set only when firmware update is ongoing. The alerts are processed normally once firmware update operation completes. Possible values are Maintenance and Normal.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Maintenance state reason
item_prototype.description: This field is set to Firmware update when the server is put under maintenance.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Memory
item_prototype.description: The amount of memory installed on this server hardware.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Migration state
Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Model
item_prototype.description: The model string of the full server hardware.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Part number
item_prototype.description: The part number for this server hardware.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Power state
item_prototype.description: The current power state of the server hardware. The values are Unknown, On, Off, PoweringOn, PoweringOff or Resetting.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Serial number
item_prototype.description: The serial number of the server hardware.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: State

trigger_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Has profile error
trigger_prototype.description: The unsuccessful profile application or removal.

trigger_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Is not initialized
trigger_prototype.description: The server is not initialized.

trigger_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Is unsupported
trigger_prototype.description: The server model or version is not currently supported by the appliance.

trigger_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Remove failed
trigger_prototype.description: The previous operation to remove the server hardware did not succeed. The operation should be re-attempted.

item_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: State reason
Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Status

trigger_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Has critical status
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}] is critical. Needs immediate attention.

trigger_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Has warning status
trigger_prototype.description: The status of the server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}] is warning. Needs attention soon.

trigger_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Is disabled
trigger_prototype.description: The server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}] is currently not operational.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.server_hardware["{#LOCATION}",maintenance_state])=0 and length(last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.server_hardware["{#LOCATION}",maintenance_state_reason]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Is in maintenance mode
trigger_prototype.description: The disruptive maintenance operations like firmware update can cause many server hardware alerts to be generated in a short period of time. Example: Network connectivity is lost or the server reset is detected.

trigger_prototype.expression: last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.server_hardware["{#LOCATION}",state])=4 and length(last(/HPE Synergy by HTTP/hpe.synergy.server_hardware["{#LOCATION}",state_reason]))>0
trigger_prototype.name: Server [{#SERVER_NAME}:{#LOCATION}]: Is unmanaged
trigger_prototype.description: Discovered a supported server.
